summary: This is an email chain between attorney Jeanne M. Christensen and an unnamed recipient. Christensen, representing a client who was trafficked from 2001-2004, expresses serious concerns about disclosing information to the counsel for the perpetrator, fearing it could be used to locate and physically harm her client.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen
persons.context: Attorney representing a client who was trafficked from 2001-2004. She is communicating with another party about her concerns regarding sharing information with the perpetrator's counsel, fearing for her client's safety.

events.title: Client Trafficking Period
events.description: The period during which Jeanne M. Christensen's client was trafficked.

locations: 85 Fifth Avenue, New York, NY 10003 (Wigdor LLP office)
keyFacts: Attorney Jeanne M. Christensen represents a client who was trafficked between 2001 and 2004.
Christensen expresses grave concerns that disclosing information to the counsel for the perpetrator could lead to her client being located and physically harmed.
The client reportedly believes "one hundred percent" that the perpetrator will harm her, regardless of how much time has passed.
The document is an email chain from June 2023, showing ongoing legal discussions related to the Epstein case years after the abuse occurred.
The identity of the perpetrator's counsel and the recipient of the email are not disclosed in the provided text.
